page.title: 11DRAYTON BASSETT VILLAGE
page.content: -The village of Drayton Bassett (o.s. 1900) contains 245 houses and 711 people. The village centre around the green contains the parish church of St. Peter, the village school (built 1905) with 40 pupils on roll, and the General Stores/Post Office. The village has few amenities: a workingmen's club, the Womens Institute hall, one public telephone box, a small recreation/park area and visits from the mobile library. The houses in the centre are the oldest in the village. Moving outwards (N.and E.) the houses are more widespread, these areas being expensive Birmingham computer-belt property. Further out there is arable farmland and woodland. The village has expanded greatly in the last 20 years and future development is planed (75 private houses behind the church) despite some local opposition.
